intro: Gladiolus dalenii subsp. andongensis, commonly known as the Andong gladiolus, is a rare and endemic species native to South Korea. It is characterized by its tall, erect stem and showy, colorful flowers that typically bloom in late summer. The plant belongs to the Iridaceae family and is known for its ornamental value. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it prefers well-drained soils in full sun. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
